item.title: Action recommended: Prepare for model version retirement in Azure OpenAI
item.description: Action recommended: Prepare for model version retirement in Azure OpenAI
item.atom:content: Action recommended: Prepare for model version retirement in Azure OpenAI

item.title: Azure Virtual Network Manager Security Admin Rule generally available in 45 regions
item.description: Azure Virtual Network Manager's security admin rule configuration is now generally available in 45 regions, empowering users to enforce security rules across their virtual networks globally.
item.atom:content: Azure Virtual Network Manager's security admin rule configuration is now generally available in 45 regions, empowering users to enforce security rules across their virtual networks globally.

item.title: General Availability of Azure Logic Apps connectors for IBM Mainframe and Midranges
item.description: Exciting news! Our IBM Mainframe and Midrange connectors, including IBM 3270, IBM CICS, IBM DB2, IBM i, IBM MQ, and IBM IMS, are now generally available. These connectors address highly sought-after customer requests, bring capabilities to extend Azure Logic Apps cloud native workloads with some of the oldest systems ever built for Mainframes and Midranges.
item.atom:content: Exciting news! Our IBM Mainframe and Midrange connectors, including IBM 3270, IBM CICS, IBM DB2, IBM i, IBM MQ, and IBM IMS, are now generally available. These connectors address highly sought-after customer requests, bring capabilities to extend Azure Logic Apps cloud native workloads with some of the oldest systems ever built for Mainframes and Midranges.

item.title: Public Preview of Azure OpenAI and AI Search in-app connectors for Logic Apps (Standard)
item.description: We're thrilled to announce two new built-in connectors for Azure Logic Apps: Azure OpenAI and Azure AI Search. With the increasing adoption of AI technologies, there's a growing demand to integrate these capabilities seamlessly into Logic Apps workflows. To address this need, we're launching the Public Preview of these connectors, bridging the gap between Logic Apps and AI.
item.atom:content: We're thrilled to announce two new built-in connectors for Azure Logic Apps: Azure OpenAI and Azure AI Search. With the increasing adoption of AI technologies, there's a growing demand to integrate these capabilities seamlessly into Logic Apps workflows. To address this need, we're launching the Public Preview of these connectors, bridging the gap between Logic Apps and AI.

item.title: Public Preview: Resiliency Review on Azure Advisor
item.description: Improve your workload’s resiliency and optimize your cloud deployments by reviewing recommendations on Advisor
item.atom:content: Improve your workload’s resiliency and optimize your cloud deployments by reviewing recommendations on Advisor

item.title: Generally Available: AKS cost views
item.description: The Kubernetes clusters and Kubernetes namespaces cost views are now generally available in Cost analysis within Azure portal. You can view the aggregated costs for all your AKS clusters and namespaces across a subscription and drill down into infrastructure and namespaces costs of a cluster.
item.atom:content: The Kubernetes clusters and Kubernetes namespaces cost views are now generally available in Cost analysis within Azure portal. You can view the aggregated costs for all your AKS clusters and namespaces across a subscription and drill down into infrastructure and namespaces costs of a cluster.

item.title: Announcing General Availability of Azure API Management Basic v2 and Standard v2 Tiers
item.description: We're thrilled to announce the General Availability of Azure API Management's newest pricing tiers – Basic v2 and Standard v2. The Azure API Management v2 pricing tiers represent a significant leap forward, offering a comprehensive range of capabilities tailored to projects of all sizes, from small-scale endeavors to large-scale enterprise applications. Importantly, these new v2 pricing tiers are available alongside our existing Azure API Management classic pricing tiers, ensuring continuity for users. It's worth noting that the Azure API Management classic pricing tiers remain actively supported and invested in.
item.atom:content: We're thrilled to announce the General Availability of Azure API Management's newest pricing tiers – Basic v2 and Standard v2. The Azure API Management v2 pricing tiers represent a significant leap forward, offering a comprehensive range of capabilities tailored to projects of all sizes, from small-scale endeavors to large-scale enterprise applications. Importantly, these new v2 pricing tiers are available alongside our existing Azure API Management classic pricing tiers, ensuring continuity for users. It's worth noting that the Azure API Management classic pricing tiers remain actively supported and invested in.

item.title: GA: Azure API Management Developer Portal Unveils Enhanced Features for Increased Developer Productivity
item.description: The API Management developer portal is an automatically generated, fully customizable website with the documentation of your APIs. It's where API consumers can discover your APIs, learn how to use them, request access, and try them out. We recently improved the portal editor interface to boost your productivity and enhance the interactions with your favorite features and tools.
item.atom:content: The API Management developer portal is an automatically generated, fully customizable website with the documentation of your APIs. It's where API consumers can discover your APIs, learn how to use them, request access, and try them out. We recently improved the portal editor interface to boost your productivity and enhance the interactions with your favorite features and tools.

item.title: Public preview: ExpressRoute Metro for High Resiliency
item.description: ExpressRoute lets you extend your on-premises networks into the Microsoft cloud over a private connection with the help of a connectivity provider. With ExpressRoute, you can establish connections to Microsoft cloud services, such as Microsoft Azure and Microsoft 365.
item.atom:content: ExpressRoute lets you extend your on-premises networks into the Microsoft cloud over a private connection with the help of a connectivity provider. With ExpressRoute, you can establish connections to Microsoft cloud services, such as Microsoft Azure and Microsoft 365.

item.title: Public preview: Azure Backup supports long term retention for backup of Azure Database for MySQL– Flexible Server
item.description: Now you can retain backups for up to 10 years by defining your own backup and retention policy for MySQL- Flexible server.
item.atom:content: Now you can retain backups for up to 10 years by defining your own backup and retention policy for MySQL- Flexible server.

item.category: Azure Database for PostgreSQL; Azure Backup
item.title: Public Preview: Azure Backup enables vaulted backups for Azure Files for comprehensive data protection.
item.description: Azure Backup now supports transferring Azure Files backups to the vault for comprehensive protection against severe data loss scenarios like ransomware attack.
item.atom:content: Azure Backup now supports transferring Azure Files backups to the vault for comprehensive protection against severe data loss scenarios like ransomware attack.

item.title: Custom .net deserializer for Azure Stream Analytics will be retired on 30 September 2024
item.description: Custom .net deserializer for Azure Stream Analytics will be retired on 30 September 2024. After that date, it won't be possible to use the feature. Please transition to a JSON, AVRO, or CSV built-in deserializer by that date.
item.atom:content: Custom .net deserializer for Azure Stream Analytics will be retired on 30 September 2024. After that date, it won't be possible to use the feature. Please transition to a JSON, AVRO, or CSV built-in deserializer by that date.

item.title: Azure HDInsight 5.0 will be retired on 31 March 2025
item.description: Azure HDInsight 5.0 for cluster shapes Kafka, Interactive Query, and Spark will retire on 31 March 2025. HDInsight, 5.1 is Generally available from November 1, 2023, this release contains all the latest versions of supported software. It comes with all the improvements made in open-source versions and the integrations from Microsoft.
item.atom:content: Azure HDInsight 5.0 for cluster shapes Kafka, Interactive Query, and Spark will retire on 31 March 2025. item.description: Every-write AOF will be retired on 1 April 2025, and all instances using the feature will automatically switch to use every-second AOF instead.
item.atom:content: Every-write AOF will be retired on 1 April 2025, and all instances using the feature will automatically switch to use every-second AOF instead.

item.title: General availability: Availability zone volume placement for Azure NetApp Files
item.description: Deploy new Azure NetApp Files volumes in Azure availability zones (AZs) of your choice to support workloads across multiple availability zones
item.atom:content: Deploy new Azure NetApp Files volumes in Azure availability zones (AZs) of your choice to support workloads across multiple availability zones

item.title: Azure Sphere version 24.03 and Azure Sphere (Integrated) are now generally available
item.description: The Azure Sphere 24.03 release includes Azure Sphere (Integrated) general availability, support for custom certificates to connect to Azure IoT Services, an updated version of cURL for the Azure Sphere OS, security fixes, SDK support for Ubuntu 24.04 pre-release, removal of SDK support for Ubuntu 18.04 LTS, and changes to the CMake toolchain.
item.atom:content: The Azure Sphere 24.03 release includes Azure Sphere (Integrated) general availability, support for custom certificates to connect to Azure IoT Services, an updated version of cURL for the Azure Sphere OS, security fixes, SDK support for Ubuntu 24.04 pre-release, removal of SDK support for Ubuntu 18.04 LTS, and changes to the CMake toolchain.

item.title: Preview: Improved throughput performance on Azure Disks’ Standard SSD
item.description: Azure Disks Standard SSD throughput limits are now 100 MB/s on disks sized 8191 GBs and lower.
item.atom:content: Azure Disks Standard SSD throughput limits are now 100 MB/s on disks sized 8191 GBs and lower.

item.title: GA: Azure Logic Apps Designer for Consumption
item.description: We're thrilled to announce the general availability of the new Azure Logic Apps Designer for Consumption, revolutionizing your workflow experience with unparalleled speed, smoothness, and reliability. Unifying the designer experience across all supported platforms, including standard Azure Logic Apps, the Azure Logic Apps Visual Studio Code extension, and consumption Azure Logic Apps in the portal, ensures seamless usability and familiarity wherever you work.
item.atom:content: We're thrilled to announce the general availability of the new Azure Logic Apps Designer for Consumption, revolutionizing your workflow experience with unparalleled speed, smoothness, and reliability. Unifying the designer experience across all supported platforms, including standard Azure Logic Apps, the Azure Logic Apps Visual Studio Code extension, and consumption Azure Logic Apps in the portal, ensures seamless usability and familiarity wherever you work.

item.title: Public Preview: Safety evaluations for generative AI applications in Azure AI Studio
item.description: Measure your generative AI application’s susceptibility to jailbreak attacks and to producing unsafe content, so you can implement effective mitigations and go from prototype to production with confidence.
item.atom:content: Measure your generative AI application’s susceptibility to jailbreak attacks and to producing unsafe content, so you can implement effective mitigations and go from prototype to production with confidence.

item.atom:content: Microsoft Dev Box is generally available in Southeast Asia, Brazil South, South Africa North, and Switzerland North.

item.atom:content: You can now build application logic in Azure Function apps which can be driven by the data from Azure SQL database

item.title: Generally Available: Free managed certificates on Azure Container Apps

item.atom:content: Azure Container Apps now provides a free managed certificate for your custom domain.

item.description: You can now use Azure Key Vault to store and manage your own TLS/SSL certificates for use with Azure Container Apps.
item.atom:content: You can now use Azure Key Vault to store and manage your own TLS/SSL certificates for use with Azure Container Apps.

item.atom:content: You can now develop apps using PowerShell 7.4 locally and deploy them to Azure Functions

item.atom:content: You can now use open-source standards to send your app’s data.

item.description: Invoke Azure Machine Learning models in real-time from SQL in Azure Database for PostgreSQL.

item.title: General availability: Migration service in Azure Database for PostgreSQL
item.description: Seamlessly migrate PostgreSQL to Azure using a managed service for complete schema and data transfers, hassle-free.
item.atom:content: Seamlessly migrate PostgreSQL to Azure using a managed service for complete schema and data transfers, hassle-free.

item.title: General availability: Rate Limiting on ExpressRoute Direct Circuits
item.description: Rate Limiting is now generally available over ExpressRoute Direct port circuits, providing enhanced control over bandwidth usage. This Quality of Service (QoS) feature prevents circuits from bursting beyond their configured bandwidth, thereby improving network performance and reliability. Rate Limiting can be enabled for each circuit individually, offering flexibility to prioritize certain circuits. This feature can be activated during or after the creation of the ExpressRoute Direct circuit.
item.atom:content: Rate Limiting is now generally available over ExpressRoute Direct port circuits, providing enhanced control over bandwidth usage. This Quality of Service (QoS) feature prevents circuits from bursting beyond their configured bandwidth, thereby improving network performance and reliability. Rate Limiting can be enabled for each circuit individually, offering flexibility to prioritize certain circuits. This feature can be activated during or after the creation of the ExpressRoute Direct circuit.

item.title: Public Preview: On-demand capacity reservations for Specialty SKUs
item.description: You can now reserve capacity with SLA for following Specialty VM sizes, Mv3 series, NC-series (v3 and newer), NV-series (v2 and newer), and Lsv2 series
item.atom:content: You can now reserve capacity with SLA for following Specialty VM sizes, Mv3 series, NC-series (v3 and newer), NV-series (v2 and newer), and Lsv2 series

item.title: Public preview: Change partition key of a container in Azure Cosmos DB (NoSQL API)
item.description: The ability to change the partition key of a container in Azure Cosmos is now available in preview for NoSQL API.
item.atom:content: The ability to change the partition key of a container in Azure Cosmos is now available in preview for NoSQL API.

item.title: Public Preview: Azure SQL Database Mirroring in Microsoft Fabric
item.description: Mirroring Azure SQL Database provides an easy experience to continuously replicate SQL DB data directly into Microsoft Fabric.
item.atom:content: Mirroring Azure SQL Database provides an easy experience to continuously replicate SQL DB data directly into Microsoft Fabric.

item.title: Azure Static Web Apps distributed functions capability now in Public Preview
item.description: Reduced latency by distributing managed functions to regions of high demand.
item.atom:content: Reduced latency by distributing managed functions to regions of high demand.

item.title: Breaking Changes to Azure API Management Workspaces
item.description:
As part of our commitment to enhancing workspaces (in Public Preview) within Azure API Management, we are implementing several critical breaking changes effective June 14, 2024. These changes are designed to streamline functionality and improve overall performance.
These breaking changes will be effective from June 14, 2024. We strongly advise making any necessary adjustments to your workspace configurations before this date to ensure uninterrupted service.
item.atom:content:
As part of our commitment to enhancing workspaces (in Public Preview) within Azure API Management, we are implementing several critical breaking changes effective June 14, 2024. These changes are designed to streamline functionality and improve overall performance.
These breaking changes will be effective from June 14, 2024. We strongly advise making any necessary adjustments to your workspace configurations before this date to ensure uninterrupted service.

item.title: General Availability: Automatic Scaling for App Service Web Apps
item.description: Azure App Service is pleased to announce general availability of the "Automatic Scaling" feature.
item.atom:content: Azure App Service is pleased to announce general availability of the "Automatic Scaling" feature.

item.title: Preview: New Features in Azure Container Storage
item.description: Azure Container Storage is a fully managed volume orchestration service built natively for containers. New capabilities include support for Temp SSD, simplified installation via AKS CLI, and scalable storage for cost-efficient workload management.
item.atom:content: Azure Container Storage is a fully managed volume orchestration service built natively for containers. New capabilities include support for Temp SSD, simplified installation via AKS CLI, and scalable storage for cost-efficient workload management.

item.atom:content: Azure VM backup now supports agentless multi-disk crash consistent backups in public preview.

item.title: Azure Content Moderator will be retired on 15 March 2027
item.description: We encourage users to explore our new offering Azure AI Content Safety that offers both new and updated capabilities to meet your content moderation needs.
item.atom:content: We encourage users to explore our new offering Azure AI Content Safety that offers both new and updated capabilities to meet your content moderation needs.

item.title: Basic and Standard A-series VMs on HDInsight will retire on 31 August 2024
item.description:
On 31 August 2024, Azure will retire Basic and Standard A-series VMs as announced earlier on 24 August 2021.
Before 31 August 2024, you need to migrate your HDInsight A series VMs to Av2-series VMs, which provide more memory per vCPU and faster storage on solid-state drives (SSDs). To avoid service disruptions, migrate your workloads from Basic and Standard A-series VMs to Av2-series VMs before 31 August 2024.
item.atom:content:
On 31 August 2024, Azure will retire Basic and Standard A-series VMs as announced earlier on 24 August 2021.
Before 31 August 2024, you need to migrate your HDInsight A series VMs to Av2-series VMs, which provide more memory per vCPU and faster storage on solid-state drives (SSDs). To avoid service disruptions, migrate your workloads from Basic and Standard A-series VMs to Av2-series VMs before 31 August 2024.

item.title: Support for Connector for AWS in Cost Management is ending on 31 March 2025
item.description: The Connector for AWS in the Cost Management service will be retired on 31 March 2025. By that date, please consider alternative cost management reporting for AWS available in the market.
item.atom:content: The Connector for AWS in the Cost Management service will be retired on 31 March 2025. By that date, please consider alternative cost management reporting for AWS available in the market.

item.atom:content: Enable in-depth, managed monitoring of Azure SQL databases, elastic pools, and managed instances.

item.title: Generally available: Application Gateway (v2) IPv6 support
item.description: Azure Application Gateway v2 enables dual-stack (IPv4 and IPv6) connectivity from the clients, providing more flexible and reliable access to the backend Applications.
item.atom:content: Azure Application Gateway v2 enables dual-stack (IPv4 and IPv6) connectivity from the clients, providing more flexible and reliable access to the backend Applications.

item.title: General availability: Listener TLS certificates management in the Azure portal
item.description: You can now manage the TLS certificates associated with Listeners through Azure portal.
item.atom:content: You can now manage the TLS certificates associated with Listeners through Azure portal.

item.title: Generally available: Azure Health Data Services DICOM service with Azure Data Lake Storage
item.description: With the integration of Azure Data Lake Storage and the DICOM service, organizations can now enjoy full control over their imaging data and increased flexibility for accessing and working with that data through the Azure storage ecosystem and APIs.
item.atom:content: With the integration of Azure Data Lake Storage and the DICOM service, organizations can now enjoy full control over their imaging data and increased flexibility for accessing and working with that data through the Azure storage ecosystem and APIs.

item.title: Operator and CRD support with Azure Managed Prometheus
item.description: Azure Monitor managed service for Prometheus will support CRD-based configs for scrape jobs to collect metrics from workloads running in your AKS cluster. With this new update, customers can use custom resources (service monitor and pod monitor) to configure metric collection with Managed Prometheus.
item.atom:content: Azure Monitor managed service for Prometheus will support CRD-based configs for scrape jobs to collect metrics from workloads running in your AKS cluster. With this new update, customers can use custom resources (service monitor and pod monitor) to configure metric collection with Managed Prometheus.

item.title: Microsoft open sources Retina: A cloud-native container networking observability platform
item.description: The Microsoft's Azure Container Networking team is announcing Retina, a cloud-native container networking observability platform that enables Kubernetes users, admins, and developers to visualize, observe, debug, and analyze Kubernetes’ workload traffic irrespective of Container Network Interface (CNI), operating system (OS), and cloud.
item.atom:content: The Microsoft's Azure Container Networking team is announcing Retina, a cloud-native container networking observability platform that enables Kubernetes users, admins, and developers to visualize, observe, debug, and analyze Kubernetes’ workload traffic irrespective of Container Network Interface (CNI), operating system (OS), and cloud.

item.title: Billing for Azure Monitor stateful log search alerts
item.description: Starting from May 1, 2024, you will be charged for stateful log alerts in Azure Monitor.
item.atom:content: Starting from May 1, 2024, you will be charged for stateful log alerts in Azure Monitor.

item.title: Public preview: Kubernetes AI Toolchain Operator (KAITO) add-on for AKS
item.description: You can now choose from preset LLMs with images hosted by AKS and split inferencing across multiple lower-GPU count VMs
item.atom:content: You can now choose from preset LLMs with images hosted by AKS and split inferencing across multiple lower-GPU count VMs

item.title: Generally Available: Cost analysis add-on for AKS
item.description: You can now better understand the infra costs associated with running applications at the namespace and cluster levels and identify opportunities to optimize resource utilization through an Azure native experience.
item.atom:content: You can now better understand the infra costs associated with running applications at the namespace and cluster levels and identify opportunities to optimize resource utilization through an Azure native experience.

item.title: Open-Source Fleet Workload Placement Scheduling and Override
item.description: You can now schedule workloads in Fleet based on cost and availability of resource heuristics.
item.atom:content: You can now schedule workloads in Fleet based on cost and availability of resource heuristics.

item.title: Generally Available: Windows Gen 2 VM support in AKS
item.description: YOu can now use Gen 2 VM SKUs for Windows nodepools in AKS.
item.atom:content: YOu can now use Gen 2 VM SKUs for Windows nodepools in AKS.

item.title: Public preview: Windows GPU support in AKS
item.description: You can now run GPU workloads, such as machine learning, video encoding, large simulations, and gaming, on Windows nodepools in AKS.
item.atom:content: You can now run GPU workloads, such as machine learning, video encoding, large simulations, and gaming, on Windows nodepools in AKS.

item.title: Generally Available: Kubernetes 1.29 support in AKS
item.description: You can now take advantage of Kubernetes 1.29 version with AKS in production environment.
item.atom:content: You can now take advantage of Kubernetes 1.29 version with AKS in production environment.

item.title: Generally Available: Custom kubelet configuration for Windows in AKS
item.description: You can now modify default values for kubelet parameters when using Windows nodepools in AKS.
item.atom:content: You can now modify default values for kubelet parameters when using Windows nodepools in AKS.

item.title: Public preview: Azure CNI static block IP allocation support in AKS
item.description: You can now scale beyond the current 65k Pod IPs and scale up to 1 Million Pods.
item.atom:content: You can now scale beyond the current 65k Pod IPs and scale up to 1 Million Pods.

item.title: Public preview: Deployment safeguards in AKS
item.description: You can now use deployment safeguards to implement Kubernetes best practices and get warnings on deployment or deny the deployment of manifest files that are not following best practices.
item.atom:content: You can now use deployment safeguards to implement Kubernetes best practices and get warnings on deployment or deny the deployment of manifest files that are not following best practices.

item.title: Generally Available: Azure CNI overlay dual stack Support in AKS (Linux only)
item.description: You can now deploy AKS clusters in dual stack mode which now enables resource connection through IPv4 or IPv6.
item.atom:content: You can now deploy AKS clusters in dual stack mode which now enables resource connection through IPv4 or IPv6.

item.title: Generally Available: VM IP based load balancer in AKS
item.description: You can now choose IP-based backend pool membership for new or existing clusters in AKS.
item.atom:content: You can now choose IP-based backend pool membership for new or existing clusters in AKS.

item.title: Generally Available: Host Network Security Group (NSG) control in AKS
item.description: You can now directly configure allowed ports in your nodepool settings.
item.atom:content: You can now directly configure allowed ports in your nodepool settings.

item.title: Generally Available: HostPort auto assign in AKS
item.description: AKS now lets you deploy pods without manually specifying host ports.
item.atom:content: AKS now lets you deploy pods without manually specifying host ports.

item.title: Generally Available: Instance level Public IP tags in AKS
item.description: You can now utilize Azure routing preference for your cluster, public node IPs in AKS
item.atom:content: You can now utilize Azure routing preference for your cluster, public node IPs in AKS

item.title: Public preview: Trusted launch support in AKS
item.description: Administrators can now deploy AKS nodes with verified and signed bootloaders, OS kernels, and drivers.
item.atom:content: Administrators can now deploy AKS nodes with verified and signed bootloaders, OS kernels, and drivers.

item.title: Generally Available: Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) support for 5K Node limit by default for standard tier clusters
item.description: You can now scale your AKS cluster to larger than 1000 nodes without having to request any special limit increases or whitelisting.
item.atom:content: You can now scale your AKS cluster to larger than 1000 nodes without having to request any special limit increases or whitelisting.

item.title: Public preview: Azure Modeling and Simulation Workbench
item.description: Azure Modeling and Simulation Workbench is a new service that provides a fully managed work environment for engineering development, accelerating project startup, and enabling secure collaboration between development teams.
item.atom:content: Azure Modeling and Simulation Workbench is a new service that provides a fully managed work environment for engineering development, accelerating project startup, and enabling secure collaboration between development teams.

item.title: Azure Monitor managed service for Prometheus is available in 13 additional Azure regions
item.description: Azure Managed Prometheus was announced GA in May 2023 and was available in 26 regions, with this new update Azure Managed Prometheus will be available in 13 additional regions.
item.atom:content: Azure Managed Prometheus was announced GA in May 2023 and was available in 26 regions, with this new update Azure Managed Prometheus will be available in 13 additional regions.

item.title: You can now opt in automatically renew your reservation at time of purchase.
item.description: You can now opt in automatically renew your reservation at time of purchase, which provides an easy way to continue getting reservation discounts.
item.atom:content: You can now opt in automatically renew your reservation at time of purchase, which provides an easy way to continue getting reservation discounts.

item.title: Azure Classic Administrator roles are retiring on 31 August 2024
item.description: On 31 August 2024, Azure classic administrator roles will be retired. Transition from Azure Classic Administrator roles to RBAC roles
item.atom:content: On 31 August 2024, Azure classic administrator roles will be retired. Transition from Azure Classic Administrator roles to RBAC roles

item.title: Visual Studio App Center retirement
item.description: Visual Studio App Center is scheduled for retirement on March 31, 2025.
item.atom:content: Visual Studio App Center is scheduled for retirement on March 31, 2025.

item.title: Retirement: Support for Application Gateway Web Application Firewall v2 Configuration is ending
item.description: On 15 March 2027, the Application Gateway WAF v2 Configuration will be retired. To continue using this service, switch to the Application Gateway WAF v2 Policy before the retirement date.
item.atom:content: On 15 March 2027, the Application Gateway WAF v2 Configuration will be retired. To continue using this service, switch to the Application Gateway WAF v2 Policy before the retirement date.

item.title: Azure Monitor managed service for Prometheus now supports TLS & mTLS based scraping
item.description: Azure Monitor managed service for Prometheus now supports TLS & mTLS based scraping for Prometheus instance served with TLS. To enable TLS and mTLS based scraping, you can configure the TLS settings in the ConfigMap.
item.atom:content: Azure Monitor managed service for Prometheus now supports TLS & mTLS based scraping for Prometheus instance served with TLS. To enable TLS and mTLS based scraping, you can configure the TLS settings in the ConfigMap.

item.title: Azure IoT Edge supports Ubuntu Core Snaps
item.description: We are expanding the Azure IoT Edge supported platforms to include Ubuntu Core Snaps on IoT Edge as a Tier 1 supported operating system.
item.atom:content: We are expanding the Azure IoT Edge supported platforms to include Ubuntu Core Snaps on IoT Edge as a Tier 1 supported operating system.

item.title: Now available: Free data transfer out to internet when leaving Azure
item.description: Learn how to qualify for free egress when moving your data out of Azure.
item.atom:content: Learn how to qualify for free egress when moving your data out of Azure.

item.title: Public Preview: JVM memory fit in Azure Container Apps
item.description: Java apps are now attuned to the container environment and primed for better performance and reliability by default.
item.atom:content: Java apps are now attuned to the container environment and primed for better performance and reliability by default.

item.title: Public Preview: Managed Java components in Azure Container Apps
item.description: You can now leverage managed Java components in Azure Container apps for service registry and externalized application properties.
item.atom:content: You can now leverage managed Java components in Azure Container apps for service registry and externalized application properties.

item.title: Public Preview: Tomcat support in Azure Container Apps
item.description: You can now deploy a Java application using a WAR file to Azure Container Apps.
item.atom:content: You can now deploy a Java application using a WAR file to Azure Container Apps.

item.title: Public Preview: Modernizing Azure Resource Manager Throttling
item.description: In 2024, Azure Resource Manager is introducing a revamped throttling experience for subscriptions, with increased limits and a token bucket algorithm for managing requests. This will enhance API management and improve productivity. The transition to the new architecture will be gradual, leading to a more efficient and dynamic throttling experience. For more information, consult the Azure Resource Manager documentation.
item.atom:content: In 2024, Azure Resource Manager is introducing a revamped throttling experience for subscriptions, with increased limits and a token bucket algorithm for managing requests. This will enhance API management and improve productivity. The transition to the new architecture will be gradual, leading to a more efficient and dynamic throttling experience. For more information, consult the Azure Resource Manager documentation.

item.title: Public Preview: Azure SQL updates for mid-March 2024
item.description: Public preview enhancements and updates released for Azure SQL in mid-March 2024.
item.atom:content: Public preview enhancements and updates released for Azure SQL in mid-March 2024.

item.title: General Availability: Azure Defender for Microsoft Azure Database for PostgreSQL - Flexible Server
item.description: Defender for Cloud detects anomalous activities indicating unusual and potentially harmful attempts to access or exploit databases. When deployed, it provides another important security barrier.
item.atom:content: Defender for Cloud detects anomalous activities indicating unusual and potentially harmful attempts to access or exploit databases. When deployed, it provides another important security barrier.

item.title: General Availability: Private Link in Azure Cosmos DB for MongoDB vCore
item.description: Private endpoint for Azure Cosmos DB via Azure Private Link is now available, enhancing security.
item.atom:content: Private endpoint for Azure Cosmos DB via Azure Private Link is now available, enhancing security.

item.title: General Availability: Major version upgrade logs for Azure Database for PostgreSQL - Flexible Server
item.description: Major version upgrade logs for Azure Database for PostgreSQL Flexible Server now generally available.
item.atom:content: Major version upgrade logs for Azure Database for PostgreSQL Flexible Server now generally available.

item.title: General availability: Additional cache size for Azure Cache for Redis Enterprise
item.description: Utilize an additional Enterprise-tier cache size to optimize the price and performance of your Redis workload.
item.atom:content: Utilize an additional Enterprise-tier cache size to optimize the price and performance of your Redis workload.

item.title: General availability: Microsoft Entra ID integration with Azure Cosmos DB for PostgreSQL
item.description: Now you can use Microsoft Entra ID authentication on Azure Cosmos DB for PostgreSQL clusters in addition or instead of the native Postgres authentication.
item.atom:content: Now you can use Microsoft Entra ID authentication on Azure Cosmos DB for PostgreSQL clusters in addition or instead of the native Postgres authentication.

item.title: Announcing Try Azure Cosmos DB support in Vercel Integration
item.description: We're excited to announce Try Azure Cosmos DB support in our Azure Cosmos DB integration with Vercel.
item.atom:content: We're excited to announce Try Azure Cosmos DB support in our Azure Cosmos DB integration with Vercel.

item.title: WhatsApp Business Platform now available for applications built on Azure
item.description: Azure Communication Services Advanced Messaging is now generally available, enabling developers to send and receive messages from their applications through third party social messaging platforms, like the WhatsApp Business Platform. This latest messaging service helps businesses create intelligent B2C communication workflows to reach more customers at scale and deliver safe, reliable communications to customers worldwide.
item.atom:content: Azure Communication Services Advanced Messaging is now generally available, enabling developers to send and receive messages from their applications through third party social messaging platforms, like the WhatsApp Business Platform. This latest messaging service helps businesses create intelligent B2C communication workflows to reach more customers at scale and deliver safe, reliable communications to customers worldwide.

item.title: Generally Available: Azure Chaos Studio supports new fault for Azure Event Hubs
item.description: Azure Chaos Studio supports new faults for Azure Event Hubs.
item.atom:content: Azure Chaos Studio supports new faults for Azure Event Hubs.

item.title: Azure API Center Updates
item.description: We are pleased to announce an update to the Azure API Center extension for Visual Studio Code, introducing new capabilities for API inventory and design. Additionally, we are unveiling a new API governance feature in API Center, enabling API linting and analysis based on customer-owned design guidelines.
item.atom:content: We are pleased to announce an update to the Azure API Center extension for Visual Studio Code, introducing new capabilities for API inventory and design. Additionally, we are unveiling a new API governance feature in API Center, enabling API linting and analysis based on customer-owned design guidelines.

item.title: Generally available: Azure Blob Storage Cold Tier in Poland Central, Qatar Central and Azure China
item.description: Azure Blob Storage Cold Tier in generally available in Poland Central, Qatar Central and Azure China.
item.atom:content: Azure Blob Storage Cold Tier in generally available in Poland Central, Qatar Central and Azure China.

item.title: General Availability: App Service Backup and Restore over Azure Virtual Network
item.description: Customers can now use custom backups, to back up their web app's files and configuration data to a firewall-protected storage account.
item.atom:content: Customers can now use custom backups, to back up their web app's files and configuration data to a firewall-protected storage account.

item.title: Generally available: Service Level Agreements on Azure Blob Storage Cold Tier
item.description: Azure Blob Storage Cold Tier has published Service Level Agreements.
item.atom:content: Azure Blob Storage Cold Tier has published Service Level Agreements.

item.title: General availability: Azure Virtual Network encryption now in additional regions
item.description: Azure Virtual Network encryption is a feature of Azure Virtual Networks. Virtual network encryption allows you to seamlessly encrypt and decrypt traffic between Azure Virtual Machines. Now available in additional regions.
item.atom:content: Azure Virtual Network encryption is a feature of Azure Virtual Networks. Virtual network encryption allows you to seamlessly encrypt and decrypt traffic between Azure Virtual Machines. Now available in additional regions.

item.title: Public preview: Change Actor
item.description: Change Actor allows you to see who initiated the change and with which client that change was made, for changes across all your tenants and subscriptions.
item.atom:content: Change Actor allows you to see who initiated the change and with which client that change was made, for changes across all your tenants and subscriptions.

item.title: Generally available: Azure Functions Support for Node.js 20
item.description: Develop functions using Node.js 20 locally and deploy them to all Azure Functions plans on Linux and Windows.
item.atom:content: Develop functions using Node.js 20 locally and deploy them to all Azure Functions plans on Linux and Windows.

item.title: Public preview: Azure NetApp Files volume enhancement – allow the same file path for volumes in different availability zones
item.description: Public Preview of Azure NetApp Files volume enhancement – file path uniqueness
item.atom:content: Public Preview of Azure NetApp Files volume enhancement – file path uniqueness

item.title: Public preview: New Generation AMD VMs - Dasv6/Easv6/Fasv6
item.description: Azure introduces the latest AMD-based VMs in public preview for the D, E, and F series VMs, built on the 4th Generation AMD EPYC™ (Genoa) CPU.
item.atom:content: Azure introduces the latest AMD-based VMs in public preview for the D, E, and F series VMs, built on the 4th Generation AMD EPYC™ (Genoa) CPU.

item.title: Azure Sphere OS version 24.03 is now available for evaluation
item.description: Participate in the retail evaluation now to ensure full compatibility. The OS evaluation for this release period provides 28 days for backward-compatibility testing.
item.atom:content: Participate in the retail evaluation now to ensure full compatibility. The OS evaluation for this release period provides 28 days for backward-compatibility testing.

item.title: Public Preview: Well-Architected Framework assessment on Azure Advisor
item.description: Initiate a self-serve experience of Assessments and manage their recommendations on Azure Advisor
item.atom:content: Initiate a self-serve experience of Assessments and manage their recommendations on Azure Advisor

item.title: Cloud Services (classic) deployment model is retiring on 31 August 2024
item.description: Cloud Services (classic) retiring in August 2024.
item.atom:content: Cloud Services (classic) retiring in August 2024.

item.title: General Availability: Encryption at host for Premium SSD v2 and Ultra Disks is now available in more regions.
item.description: Encryption at host for Premium SSD v2 and Ultra Disks is now available in Canada East, West Europe, South Central US and West US 3.
item.atom:content: Encryption at host for Premium SSD v2 and Ultra Disks is now available in Canada East, West Europe, South Central US and West US 3.

item.title: Public preview: Internet inbound for Network Virtual Appliances in Virtual WAN Hubs
item.description: Public preview for internet inbound (Destination NAT) capabilities for Next-Generation Firewall Network Virtual Appliances deployed in the Virtual WAN hub. Destination NAT allows network administrators to publish applications to the broader internet through a public IP address assigned to a Firewall Network Virtual Appliance deployed in a Virtual WAN hub.
item.atom:content: Public preview for internet inbound (Destination NAT) capabilities for Next-Generation Firewall Network Virtual Appliances deployed in the Virtual WAN hub. Destination NAT allows network administrators to publish applications to the broader internet through a public IP address assigned to a Firewall Network Virtual Appliance deployed in a Virtual WAN hub.

item.title: Public preview: Azure Functions Support for HTTP Streams in Node.js
item.description: Use this feature for use cases where real time exchange and interaction between client and server over HTTP connections is needed.
item.atom:content: Use this feature for use cases where real time exchange and interaction between client and server over HTTP connections is needed.

item.title: Public preview: Kubernetes 1.29 support in AKS
item.description: You can now try out Kubernetes 1.29 preview version with AKS and get ready for Kubernetes 1.29 GA in your production environment.
item.atom:content: You can now try out Kubernetes 1.29 preview version with AKS and get ready for Kubernetes 1.29 GA in your production environment.

item.title: Public preview: OS SKU in-place migration for Linux nodes
item.description: You can now migrate nodes from one Linux OS to another without having to create new nodes.
item.atom:content: You can now migrate nodes from one Linux OS to another without having to create new nodes.

item.title: Generally Available: AKS support for node soak duration for upgrades
item.description: You can now stagger AKS node upgrades and minimize application downtime.
item.atom:content: You can now stagger AKS node upgrades and minimize application downtime.

item.title: Generally Available: Capacity Reservations support in AKS
item.description: You can now better manage your changing workload demands by using capacity reservation groups.
item.atom:content: You can now better manage your changing workload demands by using capacity reservation groups.

item.title: GA: Istio-based service mesh add-on for Azure Kubernetes Service
item.description: You can deploy an officially supported Istio addon for AKS
item.atom:content: You can deploy an officially supported Istio addon for AKS

item.title: Public preview: Disable network policy in AKS for migration
item.description: You can now temporarily disable your network policy engines to perform a migration.
item.atom:content: You can now temporarily disable your network policy engines to perform a migration.

item.title: Public Preview: Azure SQL updates for late-February 2024
item.description: Public preview enhancements and updates released for Azure SQL in late-February 2024.
item.atom:content: Public preview enhancements and updates released for Azure SQL in late-February 2024.

item.title: General availability: Latest PostgreSQL minor versions supported by Azure Database for PostgreSQL - Flexible Server

item.title: General availability: Azure SDKs support for Azure Cosmos DB for PostgreSQL
item.description: Now you can use Azure SDKs including .NET SDK, Go SDK, Java SDK, JavaScript SDK, and Python SDK to manage the lifecycle of Azure Cosmos DB for PostgreSQL clusters.
item.atom:content: Now you can use Azure SDKs including .NET SDK, Go SDK, Java SDK, JavaScript SDK, and Python SDK to manage the lifecycle of Azure Cosmos DB for PostgreSQL clusters.

item.title: General availability: Azure CLI support for Azure Cosmos DB for PostgreSQL
item.description: You can now use Azure CLI to manage the whole lifecycle of Azure Cosmos DB for PostgreSQL clusters from provisioning to scaling to configuration changes and starting/stopping cluster compute.
item.atom:content: You can now use Azure CLI to manage the whole lifecycle of Azure Cosmos DB for PostgreSQL clusters from provisioning to scaling to configuration changes and starting/stopping cluster compute.

item.title: General availability: Application Gateway for Containers
item.description: Application Gateway for Containers is the next evolution to Application Gateway's Ingress Controller; bringing performance, scale, deployment, and feature enhancements.
item.atom:content: Application Gateway for Containers is the next evolution to Application Gateway's Ingress Controller; bringing performance, scale, deployment, and feature enhancements.

item.title: Enable replication for added VMware VM data disks
item.description: Azure Site Recovery now supports enabling replication for data disks that you add to a VMware VM that's already enabled for disaster recovery.
item.atom:content: Azure Site Recovery now supports enabling replication for data disks that you add to a VMware VM that's already enabled for disaster recovery.

item.title: Public preview: Azure Application Gateway introduces support for TLS and TCP protocols
item.description: TLS and TCP protocol support now available through Azure Application Gateway.
item.atom:content: TLS and TCP protocol support now available through Azure Application Gateway.

item.title: Announcing NBCROW Compression in Kusto's TDS Implementation
item.description: A new feature that reduces the data transfer for MSSQL queries on Kusto.
item.atom:content: A new feature that reduces the data transfer for MSSQL queries on Kusto.

item.title: Sending a log search alert with cross tenant target resource will no longer be supported
item.description: As of March 15, 2024, this behavior will change and sending a log search alert with a cross tenant target resource (except for the lighthouse case) will no longer be supported. Alerts will not be sent to unauthorized target resources, and log search alert rules with an unauthorized target will be ignored. This will ensure that only authorized users can receive and investigate log search alerts.
item.atom:content: As of March 15, 2024, this behavior will change and sending a log search alert with a cross tenant target resource (except for the lighthouse case) will no longer be supported. Alerts will not be sent to unauthorized target resources, and log search alert rules with an unauthorized target will be ignored. This will ensure that only authorized users can receive and investigate log search alerts.

item.title: Update records in a Kusto Database (public preview)
item.description: The new .update command allows you to update records (rows) in a Kusto Database (either in Azure Data Explorer or in Fabric KQL Database). This is a new tool to help you build great data pipeline!
item.atom:content: The new .update command allows you to update records (rows) in a Kusto Database (either in Azure Data Explorer or in Fabric KQL Database). This is a new tool to help you build great data pipeline!

item.title: Public Preview: Regional Disaster Recovery by Azure Backup for AKS
item.description: Customers can now utilize Azure Backup for AKS to recover their containerized applications and data during a regional disaster scenario.
item.atom:content: Customers can now utilize Azure Backup for AKS to recover their containerized applications and data during a regional disaster scenario.

item.atom:content: Customization enables developers to efficiently configure workstations to their exact project requirements, within guardrails set by admins that enforce governance and security policies.

item.atom:content: Azure China cloud regions now support Trusted Launch Virtual Machines to improve security posture of an Azure Virtual Machine.

item.atom:content: Azure Blob Change Feed and Object Replication now support Azure Blob Storage Cold Tier.

item.title: General availability: Customer managed key encryption for Enterprise tier caches

item.title: Public preview: Migration service in Azure Database for PostgreSQL
item.description: Easily migrate PostgreSQL to Azure with a managed service supporting full schema and data migrations, without complexity.
item.atom:content: Easily migrate PostgreSQL to Azure with a managed service supporting full schema and data migrations, without complexity.

item.title: Public preview: Azure SQL migration assessment enabled by Azure Arc

item.atom:content: With SQL Server enabled by Azure Arc you can now begin your migration journey from directly within the Azure Arc environment with recommended Azure SQL deployment option that best fits your workload needs.

item.title: Azure Firewall: Flow Trace Logs and Autoscaling based on number of connections are now generally available
item.description: Flow Trace Logs provide more visibility into the TCP handshake, providing insight into whether traffic is properly flowing through the firewall. In addition, Azure Firewall can now autoscale based on number of connections, providing more scaling adaptability to dynamic workloads.
item.atom:content: Flow Trace Logs provide more visibility into the TCP handshake, providing insight into whether traffic is properly flowing through the firewall. In addition, Azure Firewall can now autoscale based on number of connections, providing more scaling adaptability to dynamic workloads.

item.title: Azure Firewall: Parallel IP Group update support is now in public preview
item.description: Parallel IP Group support enables administrators to simultaneously update multiple IP Groups in a firewall, streamlining the process of implementing devOps changes.
item.atom:content: Parallel IP Group support enables administrators to simultaneously update multiple IP Groups in a firewall, streamlining the process of implementing devOps changes.

item.title: Azure Elastic SAN is now generally available
item.description: Azure Elastic SAN is now generally available, the industry’s first fully managed and cloud-native SAN offering that simplifies deploying, scaling, managing, and configuring a SAN in the cloud.
item.atom:content: Azure Elastic SAN is now generally available, the industry’s first fully managed and cloud-native SAN offering that simplifies deploying, scaling, managing, and configuring a SAN in the cloud.

item.title: Public preview: AKS cluster control plane metrics in managed Prometheus
item.description: You can now monitor the health, load and performance of the API server and etcd in the control plane of your AKS clusters
item.atom:content: You can now monitor the health, load and performance of the API server and etcd in the control plane of your AKS clusters

item.title: Generally available: Zone Redundant Storage for Azure Disks is now available in Canada Central
item.description: Zone Redundant Storage (ZRS) for Azure Disks is now available on Azure Premium SSD and Standard SSD in the Canada Central region.
item.atom:content: Zone Redundant Storage (ZRS) for Azure Disks is now available on Azure Premium SSD and Standard SSD in the Canada Central region.

item.title: General availability: Improvements in Azure Key Vault
item.description: Improvements in Azure Key Vault: FIPS 140-2 Level 3, PCI DSS and PCI 3DS certified for all customers.
item.atom:content: Improvements in Azure Key Vault: FIPS 140-2 Level 3, PCI DSS and PCI 3DS certified for all customers.

item.title: Public Preview: Azure NetApp Files Standard Network Features - Edit Volumes in US Gov Regions
item.description: Azure NetApp Files in US Gov region now supports ability to edit existing ANF volumes and upgrading Basic network features to Standard network features.
item.atom:content: Azure NetApp Files in US Gov region now supports ability to edit existing ANF volumes and upgrading Basic network features to Standard network features.

item.title: Generally available: Support for up to 100 TB of storage for the FHIR service
item.description: The FHIR service in Azure Health Data Services supports up to 100 TB of storage. The FHIR service can store and exchange large amounts of health data, and each FHIR service instance has a 4 TB storage limit by default. However, if you have more data, you can ask Microsoft to increase storage up to 100 TB for your FHIR service.
item.atom:content: The FHIR service in Azure Health Data Services supports up to 100 TB of storage. The FHIR service can store and exchange large amounts of health data, and each FHIR service instance has a 4 TB storage limit by default. However, if you have more data, you can ask Microsoft to increase storage up to 100 TB for your FHIR service.

item.title: Azure Ultra Disk Storage is now available in Canada East
item.description: Now available in Canada East region, Azure Ultra Disk Storage provides high performance along with sub-millisecond latency for your most-demanding workloads.
item.atom:content: Now available in Canada East region, Azure Ultra Disk Storage provides high performance along with sub-millisecond latency for your most-demanding workloads.

item.title: Mount Azure Storage as a local share in App Service Linux Now supports NFS
item.description: NFS support is now available for App Service Linux code and container when mounting a Azure File share as a local share for the web app.
item.atom:content: NFS support is now available for App Service Linux code and container when mounting a Azure File share as a local share for the web app.

item.title: Announcing General Availability to migrate Virtual Network injected Azure Data Explorer Cluster to Private Endpoints
item.description: The migration of Azure Virtual Network injected Azure Data Explorer cluster to Private Endpoints in generally available now. The process is simple and can be done using the Azure portal, the ARM template, or any code which uses the ADX SDK.
item.atom:content: The migration of Azure Virtual Network injected Azure Data Explorer cluster to Private Endpoints in generally available now. The process is simple and can be done using the Azure portal, the ARM template, or any code which uses the ADX SDK.

item.title: Support for log alert rules that use cross-workspace queries with resource names or qualified name identifiers will be retired on 31 May 2024
item.description: As of May 31, 2024, log alert rules will no longer support cross-workspace queries that use resource names or qualified name identifiers.
item.atom:content: As of May 31, 2024, log alert rules will no longer support cross-workspace queries that use resource names or qualified name identifiers.

item.title: Azure Virtual Network Manager security admin rule generally available in 30 regions
item.description: Azure Virtual Network Manager's security admin rule configuration is now generally available in 30 regions, empowering users to enforce security rules across their virtual networks globally.
item.atom:content: Azure Virtual Network Manager's security admin rule configuration is now generally available in 30 regions, empowering users to enforce security rules across their virtual networks globally.

item.title: Azure Virtual Network Manager topology view now generally available
item.description: Visualize Azure Virtual Network Manager connectivity configurations with topology view.
item.atom:content: Visualize Azure Virtual Network Manager connectivity configurations with topology view.

item.title: Private Preview: Azure Site Recovery support for Azure Trusted Launch VMs (Windows OS)
item.description: Azure Site Recovery support for Azure Trusted Launch VMs
item.atom:content: Azure Site Recovery support for Azure Trusted Launch VMs

item.title: Generally Available: Azure Stack HCI latest feature release
item.description: Azure Stack HCI is the Microsoft Azure Arc-enabled infrastructure. Now, customers who have an Azure Stack HCI subscription can download the latest feature release for their infrastructure. This new Azure Stack HCI release is the version of the product required to run Azure Virtual Desktop on- prem which is also now in GA and called Azure Virtual Desktop for Azure Stack HCI. This is an exciting development as the public preview of this product is in high demand specifically in Healthcare and Financial Services.
item.atom:content: Azure Stack HCI is the Microsoft Azure Arc-enabled infrastructure. Now, customers who have an Azure Stack HCI subscription can download the latest feature release for their infrastructure. This new Azure Stack HCI release is the version of the product required to run Azure Virtual Desktop on- prem which is also now in GA and called Azure Virtual Desktop for Azure Stack HCI. This is an exciting development as the public preview of this product is in high demand specifically in Healthcare and Financial Services.

item.title: Generally Available: Continuous model monitoring in Azure Machine Learning
item.description: Azure Machine Learning model monitoring is now generally available.
item.atom:content: Azure Machine Learning model monitoring is now generally available.

item.title: Public Preview: Azure Monitor introduces Prometheus community recommended alerts
item.description: Enable Prometheus community recommended alerts to monitor key signals to be promptly notified on potential critical issues within your clusters.
item.atom:content: Enable Prometheus community recommended alerts to monitor key signals to be promptly notified on potential critical issues within your clusters.

item.title: Announcing General Availability of Azure Monitor Metrics Data Plane API
item.description: General Availability of Azure Monitor Metrics Data plane API We are excited to share Azure Monitor Metrics Data Plane API is Now Generally Available! Unlock enhanced insights into the monitoring of your Azure resources with our powerful API. Explore its features and elevate your monitoring experience today!
item.atom:content: General Availability of Azure Monitor Metrics Data plane API We are excited to share Azure Monitor Metrics Data Plane API is Now Generally Available! Unlock enhanced insights into the monitoring of your Azure resources with our powerful API. Explore its features and elevate your monitoring experience today!

item.title: Public Preview: Azure API Center – January Updates
item.description: Azure API Center is your one-stop solution for inventorying and managing your organization’s APIs. In this update, we are bringing you new features and improvements to help you discover, reuse, and consume your APIs more easily and efficiently. These features are designed to help you streamline your API lifecycle, improve your developer experience, and increase your API adoption.
item.atom:content: Azure API Center is your one-stop solution for inventorying and managing your organization’s APIs. In this update, we are bringing you new features and improvements to help you discover, reuse, and consume your APIs more easily and efficiently. These features are designed to help you streamline your API lifecycle, improve your developer experience, and increase your API adoption.

item.title: Public preview: Istio add-on for AKS now supports plug-in certificate authority (CA)
item.description: You can now bring your own certificates and keys to use with Istio add-on for signing workload certificates for improved security.
item.atom:content: You can now bring your own certificates and keys to use with Istio add-on for signing workload certificates for improved security.

item.title: Generally Available: Support for Cross Region Restore for PostgreSQL backups
item.description: Cross region for Backup vault using Azure Backup is now generally available.
item.atom:content: Cross region for Backup vault using Azure Backup is now generally available.

item.title: Public preview: Upgrade support in Istio add-on for AKS
item.description: You can now upgrade to new Istio revisions as they are made available in the Istio add-on for AKS.
item.atom:content: You can now upgrade to new Istio revisions as they are made available in the Istio add-on for AKS.

item.title: Public Preview: New major version of durable Functions extension
item.description: Durable Functions extension v3.0.0 is currently in public preview. This new major version introduces major changes that benefit those using Azure Storage backend.
item.atom:content: Durable Functions extension v3.0.0 is currently in public preview. This new major version introduces major changes that benefit those using Azure Storage backend.

item.title: Public Preview: Azure Functions Support for Java 21 on Linux
item.description: Azure Functions now supports Java 21 in preview on dedicated, consumption, and premium plans for Linux.
item.atom:content: Azure Functions now supports Java 21 in preview on dedicated, consumption, and premium plans for Linux.

item.title: Generally Available: Azure Container Apps supports additional TCP ports
item.description: You can now run containers apps that accept TCP connections on multiple ports.
item.atom:content: You can now run containers apps that accept TCP connections on multiple ports.

item.title: Public Preview: Distributed tracing v2 for durable Functions
item.description: Distributed tracing v2 for durable Functions is in public preview. This version supports all languages and storage backends and provides detailed spans.
item.atom:content: Distributed tracing v2 for durable Functions is in public preview. This version supports all languages and storage backends and provides detailed spans.

item.title: Visual Studio Code extension update for Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS)
item.description: You can use VS Code extension update for AKS to interact with a new create cluster experience, abort/reconcile cluster, and more.
item.atom:content: You can use VS Code extension update for AKS to interact with a new create cluster experience, abort/reconcile cluster, and more.

item.title: Public preview: Node OS API options feature for AKS
item.description: You can now get Node IP for tasks such as troubleshooting, without needing kubectl access
item.atom:content: You can now get Node IP for tasks such as troubleshooting, without needing kubectl access

item.title: Public preview: Disable Secure Shell (SSH) support in AKS
item.description: You can now disable SSH for AKS to reduce the attach surface on your cluster.
item.atom:content: You can now disable SSH for AKS to reduce the attach surface on your cluster.
